com.xceptance.xlt.common.actions

Class StaticContentDownloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.common.actions.StaticContentDownloader

  • public class StaticContentDownloader
extends java.lang.Object
    The StaticContentDownloader aids in managing the parallel download of resources. The goal is to better simulate the download behavior of real browsers. The number of threads working in parallel is controlled by configuration. Note that there is no differentiation between requests to different domains.

    • Constructor Summary

      • StaticContentDownloader

        public StaticContentDownloader(com.xceptance.xlt.engine.XltWebClient webClient,
                       int threadCount,
                       boolean userAgentUID)
        Creates a new RequestQueue object and initializes it with the given web client and the number of threads which process the requests.
        Parameters:
        webClient - the web client to use
        threadCount - the number of threads
        userAgentUID - do we need dynamic user agent identifiers

    • Method Detail

      • addRequest

        public void addRequest(java.net.URL url)
        Adds the given URL to the list of URLs to be loaded. Whether the URL is loaded by the calling or a separate thread is controlled by the parallelModeEnabled flag. If the flag is false, the method does not return until the URL is loaded. If the flag is true, as many URLs as threadCount can be added without blocking.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to load
        referrerUrl - the referrer URL

      • isParallelModeEnabled

        public boolean isParallelModeEnabled()
        Indicates whether or not the parallel execution of requests is enabled.
        Returns:
        the current state

      • setParallelModeEnabled

        public void setParallelModeEnabled(boolean value)
        Enables or disables the parallel execution of requests.
        Parameters:
        value - the new state

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts this request queue down. Any background thread is terminated.

      • waitForCompletion

        public void waitForCompletion()
        Waits until all previously added requests have been executed.
